metadata.synopsis: Dez Kanshaw is a farmer with family woes.

22.speaker: Dez Kanshaw
22.text: Another? Should I have another? Ilmater preserve me, I need the courage.

21.speaker: Player
21.text: Will another drink solve your problems?

52.speaker: Dez Kanshaw
52.text: No, saer. We abandoned our farm when the Absolute army marched in.

8.speaker: Dez Kanshaw
8.text: We used to sell our barley to the brewer who makes this very beer. That's all over now.

33.speaker: Player
33.text: You must be furious at the Absolute cult and their army.

46.speaker: Dez Kanshaw
46.text: Why? No more point to that than getting mad at a plague of locusts, or the weather.

7.speaker: Player
7.text: Did  you try to fight back?

27.speaker: Player
27.text: What will you country folk do here in the city?

58.speaker: Player
58.text: There's always room for anger. Especially in times like these.

36.speaker: Player
36.text: I'm sure you'll find a new trade soon enough. There's plenty about.

38.speaker: Dez Kanshaw
38.text: I'm not so sure. What good can these farmer hands do in a city like this? Besides, I've got the others to think of.

41.speaker: Player
41.text: You won't find courage in the bottom of a bottle.

49.speaker: Player
49.text: Drink up! This city is living on borrowed time.
49.context: InternalNodeContext: Tags checked on the rules inside the node

6.speaker: Player
6.text: The answer is yes - it's always yes.

3.speaker: Dez Kanshaw
3.text: No, I guess I've had enough. The brewer who made this beer used to buy all of our barley. But that's over now.

16.speaker: Dez Kanshaw
16.text: Left the crops standing in the fields when we ran from the Absolute army. Gone, all gone.

18.speaker: Dez Kanshaw
18.text: If it were only me it wouldn't be so bad, but I've got mouths to feed.

53.speaker: Dez Kanshaw
53.text: Family's upstairs, exhausted. I'm Dez Kanshaw - with a wife, two kids, and another on the way.

15.speaker: Player
15.text: But you had enough left for a drink.

26.speaker: Dez Kanshaw
26.text: One - and I shouldn't have had even that. Got work to do.

5.speaker: Dez Kanshaw
5.text: Oldest boy, Korson, he means well but he eats as much as the rest of us put together. I have to find him a place here.

30.speaker: Player
30.text: There's a war on. Can he fight?

50.speaker: Dez Kanshaw
50.text: We're farmers, not fighters. That's not the answer for us.

11.speaker: Dez Kanshaw
11.text: Oldest boy, Korson, he means well but he eats as much as the rest of us put together. I have to find him a place here.

34.speaker: Dez Kanshaw
34.text: A fancy feller called Three-Piece wants to place him as a cleaner in the Counting House. But I don't trust him.

28.speaker: Dez Kanshaw
28.text: Maybe I should just join the Flaming Fist and take the signing bonus. What else can I do?

1.speaker: Player
1.text: Three-Piece sounds like a crook. Better if you join the Fists.

40.speaker: Dez Kanshaw
40.text: That's what I was thinking too. Was drinking to get up the courage to do it.

0.speaker: Dez Kanshaw
0.text: But it's hard, because it means goodbye to our family's farm. Korson will never work those fields.

19.speaker: Dez Kanshaw
19.text: Thanks, stranger, you helped settle my mind. Thanks are all I have to offer, though. May Ilmater bleed for you.

4.speaker: Player
4.text: That cleaner job sounds steady. Leaves you available to head back to the farm.

44.speaker: Dez Kanshaw
44.text: Right. It's taking a chance, but it's worth the risk. The farm is all we have, really.

55.speaker: Player
55.text: I hear the Ilmater temple at Wyrm's needs volunteers. They don't pay, but at least the boy will eat.

43.speaker: Dez Kanshaw
43.text: Huh. That's a solid tip. Could work out for a gentle kid like Korson.

48.speaker: Player
48.text: The Thieves Guild are always on the lookout for talent. He'd never run out of work.

51.speaker: Dez Kanshaw
51.text: My gentle boy? A thief? I wouldn't have dared think of it before, but... maybe the Guild isn't a bad place to look.

14.speaker: Player
14.text: Forget the city - the wilds have everything you need.

17.speaker: Dez Kanshaw
17.text: Huh - that's true. And we're no strangers to working the land.

12.speaker: Dez Kanshaw
12.text: Korson's strong, but he's a gentle soul. Easy to take advantage of.

47.speaker: Dez Kanshaw
47.text: A fancy feller called Three-Piece wants to place Korson as a cleaner in the Counting House. But I don't trust him.

42.speaker: Player
42.text: If he can't find his own place, perhaps he doesn't deserve one.

9.speaker: Player
9.text: Life is meant for living! The boy must find his own path, as I did. As we all must.

29.speaker: Dez Kanshaw
29.text: I appreciate that some might find me a soft touch, but he's my son. I'll make no apology for looking out for him.

24.speaker: Player
24.text: Well good luck to you and your family.

57.speaker: Dez Kanshaw
57.text: Thank you kindly. And to you and yours.

13.speaker: Player
13.text: Of course, deep courage comes from a full belly.

23.speaker: Dez Kanshaw
23.text: You look as out of place here as I feel.

32.speaker: Dez Kanshaw
32.text: What say you, should I have another? Ilmater preserve me, I need the courage.

37.speaker: Dez Kanshaw
37.text: Thanks again, stranger. Ilmater guide you.
